body:
Hey cap. I had an idea for how to cleanly show the scores for comments without it getting messy or being in the way of things. My solution is to display it in the extra information bar next to the timestamp, so it would look like this:

![](https://i.imgur.com/ABS4cFF.png)

I made a pull request for it if you're interested.
body_html:
Hey cap. I had an idea for how to cleanly show the scores for comments without it getting messy or being in the way of things. My solution is to display it in the extra information bar next to the timestamp, so it would look like this:

I made a pull request for it if you're interested.

guild.description: ruqqus.com changelog
guild.description_html: ruqqus.com changelog
guild.name: changelog

post.body:
Did this yesterday.

On desktop you can now see counts of upvotes and downvotes on posts. These numbers are fuzzed by +/- 1%, rounded up (ex. 1-100 votes are fuzzed +/- 1 vote, 101-200 votes are fuzzed +/- 2 votes, etc)

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/730807967707824259/739659496082636851/image.png?width=1026&height=577)

I also implemented the infrastructure to do the same with comments, I just have to figure out how we want to display it. (Working on this part was how I broke comment voting yesterday)
post.body_html:
Did this yesterday.

On desktop you can now see counts of upvotes and downvotes on posts. These numbers are fuzzed by +/- 1%, rounded up (ex. 1-100 votes are fuzzed +/- 1 vote, 101-200 votes are fuzzed +/- 2 votes, etc)

I also implemented the infrastructure to do the same with comments, I just have to figure out how we want to display it. (Working on this part was how I broke comment voting yesterday)
post.title: Ruqqus 2.17 Update - Upvote/downvote counts shown on posts

body:
That was my initial idea too (probably most people), but I feel like that's a bit messy and confusing. I proposed a change on to the admins on github that shows it this way instead:

![](https://i.imgur.com/ABS4cFF.png)

(note: that's an image, not an embedded comment lol)

It looks cleaner and doesn't get in the way of things. Displaying "extra" information is exactly what that bar is for, so the number of upvotes/downvotes fits there perfectly.
body_html:
That was my initial idea too (probably most people), but I feel like that's a bit messy and confusing. I proposed a change on to the admins on github that shows it this way instead:

(note: that's an image, not an embedded comment lol)

It looks cleaner and doesn't get in the way of things. Displaying "extra" information is exactly what that bar is for, so the number of upvotes/downvotes fits there perfectly.

guild.description: Documenting the fall of Reddit.
guild.description_html: Documenting the fall of Reddit.
guild.name: WatchRedditDie

parent.body:
This is what I got - hadn't posted anything in a year:

Important notification about your account

subreddit message via /r/reddit.com[A] sent 2 months ago

Your account has been permanently suspended for breaking the rules.

    This account has been permanently closed. To continue using Reddit, please log out and create a new account (the username u/[REDACTED] cannot be reused).

This is an automated message; responses will not be received by Reddit admins.
parent.body_html:
This is what I got - hadn't posted anything in a year:

Important notification about your account

subreddit message via /r/reddit.com[A] sent 2 months ago

Your account has been permanently suspended for breaking the rules.

This account has been permanently closed. To continue using Reddit, please log out and create a new account (the username u/[REDACTED] cannot be reused).

This is an automated message; responses will not be received by Reddit admins.

post.body: Any time you create an account using TOR now, it *will* be shadowbanned after a few days. And they will also scrub anything you posted prior to that, but won't put it in the subreddit's spam or modqueue so the mods won't even know to approve it. Test it out and see for yourself.
post.body_html: Any time you create an account using TOR now, it will be shadowbanned after a few days. And they will also scrub anything you posted prior to that, but won't put it in the subreddit's spam or modqueue so the mods won't even know to approve it. Test it out and see for yourself.
post.title: Reddit now shadowbans every single new account that uses TOR

parent.body:
The white majority is declining in the US, down to 59% from 85% in the 60s. Within 20 years whites will be a minority and by 2100 whites will be 15% of the population, by some estimates.

If the silent majority actually opposed white replacement, mass immigration and black lives matter, then it really does not matter. If they stay silent, then no one knows they exist. They have no effect.

The globalist elite support this because rising tensions make it easier for them to govern.

Identity politics is clearly a winning strategy. What long lasting victory have conservatives had since 1960? That is around the time whites stopped advocating for the legitimate interests of white people, as a group.

guild.description:
Ask and answer questions.

Rules:

🤔 Posts must be questions. This is a community dedicated to Q&A discussion, so post titles must be in the form of a question.

⁉️ No loaded questions.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

🥾 Breaking these rules will result in posts being kicked and possibly an exile.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

post.title: To those who believe wearing a mask is taking away your freedom, why?

parent.body: Yes, they've sold out for money or perhaps they've been blacked mailed by Epstein and those connected to him. Remember when Ricky Gervais said to Hollywood "I know he's all your friend"? The elites have secured their position, the normies worship them as kings and queens and gods and goddesses. They don't just want a plain nationalistic socialist or communism government, they are promoting a global citizenship technocracy with a socialist or communism government. The UN and the World Economic Form, Davos, The Bilderberg Meetings, The Tri-lateral Commission, the Old Aristrocracy, Deep Religion, and the Occult Secret Societies are all working to pull the levers of power. It's amusing for them. They have money, now it's power and control and preventing the little people from removing that from them. They see us as too stupid too rule ourselves, they are the "enlightened few" who are to decide. Meanwhile they are sick pedophiles drunk on hedonistic pleasure. But they do some charity too, so haha they still think of themselves as justified. They don't necessarily care about good or evil, in their world, under Luciferianism, it's just: Do As You Wish. They liken themselves to gods. And they are trying to achieve that, worshipped by followers and on stages, honored for 'intellect' and beauty. They use technology to monitor their sheep, shape their perception of the world, and discipline those who step out of line. They desire to rule the world, and they may very well achieve that in full—controlling the banks, resources, land, technology, media, and governments. They really already mostly do—just quietly. They have gotten much more bold though, as no one sees nor cares (except those that are waking up). They love laughing at us. They tell the future, they tell the evil they do in the dark in their movies, music, and advertisements. They love symbolism, once you can read it, there's no going back.

i.e. "Democrats are the real racists!"

Identity politics is clearly a winning strategy. What long lasting victory have conservatives had since 1960? That is around the time whites stopped advocating for the legitimate interests of white people, as a group. 

Leftists have gotten the Hart-Cellar Act, Desegregation, Affirmative Action, Massive increases in welfare, Roe v. Wade, among other things. The Overton window continues to shift to the left. Now that you mention it, it does look like that! :D

Guess I **CURSED** my world!

But really, it's actually on a grass block directly behind the stone at the same level. The angle makes the top of the grass hard to see, and there's other blocks surrounding all other sides of the tall grass, so it creates the illusion that the stone continues under the tall grass.
body_html:
Now that you mention it, it does look like that! :D

Guess I CURSED my world!

But really, it's actually on a grass block directly behind the stone at the same level. The angle makes the top of the grass hard to see, and there's other blocks surrounding all other sides of the tall grass, so it creates the illusion that the stone continues under the tall grass.

body: This is actually a software bug. Right now the default score shows 0 instead of 1 like it's supposed to. It's not actually downvoted. There really are downvote brigades, however those will show -1 or -2 currently, or will lose previous upvotes. Fortunately the devs are working on both fixing the voting bug and mitigating the downvote brigades.
body_html: This is actually a software bug. Right now the default score shows 0 instead of 1 like it's supposed to. It's not actually downvoted. There really are downvote brigades, however those will show -1 or -2 currently, or will lose previous upvotes. Fortunately the devs are working on both fixing the voting bug and mitigating the downvote brigades.

post.body:
I've noticed some smaller guilds I follow will almost instantly have a single downvote on them for no apparent reason.  Downvoting something that is obnoxious or spam is all well and good; but if its the equivalent of posting ice cream in an ice cream guild and there's an instant downvote, its a little strange.

I have a guild where anything I post in it is almost instantly given a single downvote as well.  It happened almost immediately when I posted a song in +music too, and then later got several upvotes.

I don't know how widespread this is, but if a person or a bot does little but refresh "new" and downvote things, should there be something in place that prevents them from doing that?  For instance, the site notices you've done nothing but give x downvotes in x period of time and now you need to wait before you can downvote again.

Edit: I got an almost instant downvote for this one too.  Case in point.

Edit 2: Its a bot.  I just created +icecream, posted ice cream, refreshed the page and there was a downvote.
https://i.imgur.com/oHm9xvO.jpg
post.body_html:
I've noticed some smaller guilds I follow will almost instantly have a single downvote on them for no apparent reason. Downvoting something that is obnoxious or spam is all well and good; but if its the equivalent of posting ice cream in an ice cream guild and there's an instant downvote, its a little strange.

I have a guild where anything I post in it is almost instantly given a single downvote as well. It happened almost immediately when I posted a song in +Music too, and then later got several upvotes.

I don't know how widespread this is, but if a person or a bot does little but refresh "new" and downvote things, should there be something in place that prevents them from doing that? For instance, the site notices you've done nothing but give x downvotes in x period of time and now you need to wait before you can downvote again.

Edit: I got an almost instant downvote for this one too. Case in point.

Edit 2: Its a bot. I just created +icecream, posted ice cream, refreshed the page and there was a downvote. https://i.imgur.com/oHm9xvO.jpg
post.title: Should there be a cooldown period for downvoting?

He truly is the greatest president to have blessed America and not only that, but the entire world. I love this man.

body:
I called it "1.7" since it's based on 1.6.4, but it's so heavily modified now that it can't still be considered 1.6.4. The reason it's based on 1.6.4 is because that's the last version before major refactoring of the codebase took place, which resulted in changing functionality and myriads of code bloat and performance issues. So it's a 1.7, but not the actual one; a parallel timeline, if you will.

But you were correct, the cobblestone and brick textures and such are a resource pack.
body_html:
I called it "1.7" since it's based on 1.6.4, but it's so heavily modified now that it can't still be considered 1.6.4. The reason it's based on 1.6.4 is because that's the last version before major refactoring of the codebase took place, which resulted in changing functionality and myriads of code bloat and performance issues. So it's a 1.7, but not the actual one; a parallel timeline, if you will.

But you were correct, the cobblestone and brick textures and such are a resource pack.

guild.description:
Ruqqus is a place for all people to come abs express themselves in an intelligent manner as they see fit.

Unfortunately,  this type of free and open communication upsets many people and they form groups with which to control narratives and shame users.

Examples of this:

- The "goons" on SomethingAwful 

- /r/ShitRedditSays SJW thought control squads on reddit

- /v/protectvoat drama / harrassment architecture on voat shaming users 

This guild is for those who want to prevent this behavior from taking hold on Ruqqus,  as we've seen this destroy other websites and create echo-chambers.

If your ideas, theories, or beliefs are valid then they can stand on their own without the help of malicious brigades that shame and harrass users.

 Private guilds have a right to speak freely and congregate as they wish (within the confines of user agreement) without brigades coming and ruining the atmosphere, sending alternate accounts as they get banned.

If this sounds like something you'd be interested in,  then welcome aboard!
guild.description_html:
Ruqqus is a place for all people to come abs express themselves in an intelligent manner as they see fit.

Unfortunately, this type of free and open communication upsets many people and they form groups with which to control narratives and shame users.

Examples of this:

  • The "goons" on SomethingAwful

  • /r/ShitRedditSays SJW thought control squads on reddit

  • /v/protectvoat drama / harrassment architecture on voat shaming users

This guild is for those who want to prevent this behavior from taking hold on Ruqqus, as we've seen this destroy other websites and create echo-chambers.

If your ideas, theories, or beliefs are valid then they can stand on their own without the help of malicious brigades that shame and harrass users.

Private guilds have a right to speak freely and congregate as they wish (within the confines of user agreement) without brigades coming and ruining the atmosphere, sending alternate accounts as they get banned.

If this sounds like something you'd be interested in, then welcome aboard!
guild.name: StopBrigades

parent.body: You were at 0 just now till I upvoted you back to 1. Someone doesn't like you.
parent.body_html: You were at 0 just now till I upvoted you back to 1. Someone doesn't like you.

post.body:
I'd love to know if the people doing this are donating to the Patreon, and what the percentages are of the downvoters who are financially supporting Ruqqus vs. the people getting downvoted.

It's clearly not 'bad content.' These posts are perfectly appropriate for the Guilds they are in. I might add I see this happen on a **nightly** basis. 

How does downvoting serve to inform people whether their content is good or bad in this system? Just declare Ruqqus Voat 2.0 and be done with it at this rate.
post.body_html:

It's clearly not 'bad content.' These posts are perfectly appropriate for the Guilds they are in. I might add I see this happen on a nightly basis.

How does downvoting serve to inform people whether their content is good or bad in this system? Just declare Ruqqus Voat 2.0 and be done with it at this rate.
post.title: tHeRe aRe nO briGaDeS -- Guild appropriate 'normal' content being downvoted

parent.body:
language is python. the script is `py historyDownload.py canvas X_Y X_Y YYYY-MM-DD` (you need to download https://github.com/pixelplanetdev/pixelplanet/blob/master/utils/historyDownload.py)

to make it into a timelapse download ffmpeg (many tutorials on yt) and do `ffmpeg -framerate 15 -f image2 -i timelapse/t%d.png -c:v libvpx-vp9 -pix_fmt yuva420p output.webm`
parent.body_html:
language is python. the script is py historyDownload.py canvas X_Y X_Y YYYY-MM-DD (you need to download https://github.com/pixelplanetdev/pixelplanet/blob/master/utils/historyDownload.py)

to make it into a timelapse download ffmpeg (many tutorials on yt) and do ffmpeg -framerate 15 -f image2 -i timelapse/t%d.png -c:v libvpx-vp9 -pix_fmt yuva420p output.webm
